description: Security suites group all your security requirements into a single Interface, making it much easier to keep your PCs safe online. Free security tools are perfectly adequate if you don't mind configuring and monitoring them yourself, and even Windows' built-in security software now does a decent job of keeping your PC free from malware. With a solid backup...
text:
Security suites group all your security requirements into a single Interface,
making it much easier to keep your PCs safe online

Free security tools are perfectly adequate if you don't mind configuring and
monitoring them yourself, and even Windows' built-in security software now
does a decent job of keeping your PC free from malware. With a solid backup
regime and a few key programs to protect and clean your computer, you're as
safe on the internet as ever.

However, the level of maintenance involved isn't to everyone's liking and many
people prefer an all-encompassing security package to manage all their
security requirements in one place. For this, you need an internet security
suite.

HOW WE TESTED

Our test results draw on the work of two of the most respected
antivirustesting organisations in the world: AV-Comparatives (www.av-
comparatives .org) and AV-Test (www [.av-test.org](http://.av-test.org)). Both
carry out extensive independent testing of security products and publish
regular reports of protection scores, false positives and performance ratings.

Bitdefender Internet Security 2020 1 £14.99 (1 year, 3 devices)

Buy from Amazon: bit.ly/bitdef497

FEATURES ★★★★★ PERFORMANCE ★★★★★ EASEOFUSE ★★★★★ VALUEFORMONEY ★★★★★

Bitdefender offers one of the most effective security suites around. Its AV-
Test results achieved a perfect 100% score for malware protection and it
dropped only a few marks in the AV-Comparatives' tests. While this doesn't
quite match Norton 360's flawless record, Bitdefender did better than Norton
in the false-positive tests. The suite is nimble, too, with a creditable 94%
rating for system performance.

Bitdefender's suite has loads of options to play around with. The customisable
dashboard provides access to a selection of core features, and the Protection
and Privacy panes offer plenty more to explore. For example, the Protection
pane includes options for launching and configuring various types of scan, as
well as settings for web-based and behavioural protection. It's also where
you'll find the firewall, which runs quietly in the background, though you can
also set up your own rules and definitions. There's also a Vulnerability Scan
tool that warns you about missing updates (for Windows and other software),
and highlights weak passwords and insecure networks.

Bitdefender provides two modules to help fight ransomware: Safe Files blocks
untrusted apps from writing to selected folders, while Ransomware Remediation
automatically makes temporary backups of vulnerable files.

We were also impressed with the Rescue Environment, which avoids fiddly setup
on a DVD or USB stick and instead reserves a section of your hard drive. This
means you can't lose it and, when you find yourself worried about your
security, allows you to reboot your system to launch a scan safely within
seconds.

We found the parental controls to be the best in the group. Once you've added
the software to your children's devices, you can monitor and approve apps and
websites, and enforce screen-time limits. The Android app lets you keep an eye
on their contacts and track their location, too.

VERDICT

★★★★★

This isasuperb security suite that's extremely effective and comes loaded with
tools and features. However, it's also lightweight and easy to use. The price
is very reasonable for new users but it's worth noting that you'll be put on a
recurring contract, so be sure to switch this off and check that the price
isas good whenthe renewal date comes around the following year. If it isn't,
shop aroundfor abetter option. The other suites in this round-up have their
ownstrengths but, asa one-stop all-rounder, Bitdefender can't be beaten.

Norton 360 Deluxe 1 £20.17 (1 year, 5 devices)

Buy from Amazon: bit.ly/norton497

FEATURES ★★★★★ PERFORMANCE ★★★★★

EASEOFUSE ★★★☆☆ VALUE FOR MONEY ★★★★★

Norton's 360 suite is the only one here to include cloud backup, though this
is aimed at essential files only, with a limited amount of storage - between
10GB and 75GB, depending on the number of devices you install it on.

The suite also comes with a VPN (though this was disappointing compared to
standalone alternatives) and parental controls. Most of the other features are
hidden away in a confusing interface - the firewall, for example, is buried in
the software's settings.

Norton achieved a 100% success rate at blocking malware in the tests by both
AV-Test and AV-Comparatives. You can't argue with that: it's a brilliant
result that none of the other tools managed. It wasn't quite so good at
avoiding false positives, however, and got caught out by blocking seven safe
programs across the two testing companies.

VERDICT ★★★★☆

Norton's excellent protection rating is its best asset but it also offers a
couple of attractive extras, including VPN and cloud backup. These aren't as
good as standalone tools but they are handy to have in the mix of your
security suite.

Kaspersky Internet Security 2020 1 £23.89 (1 year,

5 devices) I Buy from Amazon: bit.ly/kaspersky497

FEATURES ★★★★★ PERFORMANCE ★★★★☆

EASEOFUSE ★★★★★VALUE FOR MONEY ★★★★☆

Kaspersky caught all the malware thrown at it by AV-Test, but didn't fare
quite so well with AV-Comparatives, where it blocked 99.6% of threats. That's
still impressive but it's the worst score of the four products reviewed here.
Where Kaspersky excelled was in avoiding false positives, achieving a clean
sheet in tests from both organisations.

The suite includes plenty of extras, such as the Safe Money browser, which you
can use any time, not just when you're banking and buying; and the Network
Monitor - a firewall that lets you control everything that accesses the
internet. Trusted Applications mode only allows you to run programs vetted and
approved by Kaspersky, while the suite's cleaning and maintenance tools get
into your PC's nooks and crannies to clean non-standard settings and out-of-
date applications.

VERDICT ☆☆☆☆☆

Despite its many tools and features, Kaspersky's performance rating of 96.8%
makes it the least draining of PC resources of the suites we tested. Shop
around, though, because it's available from retailers for far less than
Kaspersky charges.

McAfee Total Protection 1 £13.27 (1 year, 10 devices)

Buy from Amazon: bit.ly/mcafee497

FEATURES ★★★☆☆ PERFORMANCE ★★★☆☆

EASEOFUSE ★★★★☆VALUE FOR MONEY ★★★★★

Having parted ways with its former owner, Intel, McAfee has fixed its damaged
reputation and now offers vastly improved protection at a very competitive
price.

Ironically, the version named Total Protection doesn't have as many features
as its rivals - you get parental control but no backup or VPN options.
However, the real meat of this product is in its virus scanner, Web Advisor
browser extension (for Chrome and Firefox) and automatic software updater.
These tools helped McAfee stop 99.4% of the malware in the tests but while
Kaspersky fared worse in the AV-Comparatives test, Total Protection came last
place in AV-Test's. It also recorded six false positives with AV-Comparatives,
but scored a clean sheet with AV-Test. On the other hand, it did well in the
performance tests, with only Kaspersky having a lesser impact on the test PC's
operating system.

VERDICT ★★★★★

McAfee Total Protection isn't the most hawk-eyed security suite around and
it's comparatively light on features. However, it's much better than it used
to be, is very affordable and lightweight, and you can install it on twice as
many devices.

OURVERDICT

We gave our Gold Award to Bitdefender Internet Security 2020 because it
performed well, and is brimming with useful features and protection options.
All this comes at a very affordable price, though it's still worth shopping
around when it comes to renewal time.

If you don't mind paying a little more, you might consider plumping for Norton
360 Deluxe instead. Its protection was excellent, earning it our Silver Award,
and it comes with handy extras in the form of online backup and a VPN.

Our Bronze Award winner is Kaspersky, which offered the lightest tool with the
least impact on the day-to-day running of the PC it's installed on. Its
protection isn't quite up to Bitdefender and Norton standards in the most
recent tests, but it was better at avoiding false positives. -

title: Internet security suites
html:
Free security tools are perfectly adequate if you don't mind configuring and monitoring them yourself, and even Windows' built-in security software now does a decent job of keeping your PC free from malware. With a solid backup regime and a few key programs to protect and clean your computer, you're as safe on the internet as ever.

However, the level of maintenance involved isn't to everyone's liking and many people prefer an all-encompassing security package to manage all their security requirements in one place. For this, you need an internet security suite.

HOW WE TESTED

Our test results draw on the work of two of the most respected antivirustesting organisations in the world: AV-Comparatives (www.av-comparatives .org) and AV-Test (www .av-test.org). Both carry out extensive independent testing of security products and publish regular reports of protection scores, false positives and performance ratings.

Bitdefender Internet Security 2020 1 £14.99 (1 year, 3 devices)

Buy from Amazon: bit.ly/bitdef497

FEATURES ★★★★★ PERFORMANCE ★★★★★ EASEOFUSE ★★★★★ VALUEFORMONEY ★★★★★

Bitdefender offers one of the most effective security suites around. Its AV-Test results achieved a perfect 100% score for malware protection and it dropped only a few marks in the AV-Comparatives' tests. While this doesn't quite match Norton 360's flawless record, Bitdefender did better than Norton in the false-positive tests. The suite is nimble, too, with a creditable 94% rating for system performance.

Bitdefender's suite has loads of options to play around with. The customisable dashboard provides access to a selection of core features, and the Protection and Privacy panes offer plenty more to explore. For example, the Protection pane includes options for launching and configuring various types of scan, as well as settings for web-based and behavioural protection. It's also where you'll find the firewall, which runs quietly in the background, though you can also set up your own rules and definitions. There's also a Vulnerability Scan tool that warns you about missing updates (for Windows and other software), and highlights weak passwords and insecure networks.

Bitdefender provides two modules to help fight ransomware: Safe Files blocks untrusted apps from writing to selected folders, while Ransomware Remediation automatically makes temporary backups of vulnerable files.

We were also impressed with the Rescue Environment, which avoids fiddly setup on a DVD or USB stick and instead reserves a section of your hard drive. This means you can't lose it and, when you find yourself worried about your security, allows you to reboot your system to launch a scan safely within seconds.

We found the parental controls to be the best in the group. Once you've added the software to your children's devices, you can monitor and approve apps and websites, and enforce screen-time limits. The Android app lets you keep an eye on their contacts and track their location, too.

VERDICT

★★★★★

This isasuperb security suite that's extremely effective and comes loaded with tools and features. However, it's also lightweight and easy to use. The price is very reasonable for new users but it's worth noting that you'll be put on a recurring contract, so be sure to switch this off and check that the price isas good whenthe renewal date comes around the following year. If it isn't, shop aroundfor abetter option. The other suites in this round-up have their ownstrengths but, asa one-stop all-rounder, Bitdefender can't be beaten.

Norton 360 Deluxe 1 £20.17 (1 year, 5 devices)

Buy from Amazon: bit.ly/norton497

FEATURES ★★★★★ PERFORMANCE ★★★★★

EASEOFUSE ★★★☆☆ VALUE FOR MONEY ★★★★★

Norton's 360 suite is the only one here to include cloud backup, though this is aimed at essential files only, with a limited amount of storage - between 10GB and 75GB, depending on the number of devices you install it on.

The suite also comes with a VPN (though this was disappointing compared to standalone alternatives) and parental controls. Most of the other features are hidden away in a confusing interface - the firewall, for example, is buried in the software's settings.

Norton achieved a 100% success rate at blocking malware in the tests by both AV-Test and AV-Comparatives. You can't argue with that: it's a brilliant result that none of the other tools managed. It wasn't quite so good at avoiding false positives, however, and got caught out by blocking seven safe programs across the two testing companies.

VERDICT ★★★★☆

Norton's excellent protection rating is its best asset but it also offers a couple of attractive extras, including VPN and cloud backup. These aren't as good as standalone tools but they are handy to have in the mix of your security suite.

Kaspersky Internet Security 2020 1 £23.89 (1 year,

5 devices) I Buy from Amazon: bit.ly/kaspersky497

FEATURES ★★★★★ PERFORMANCE ★★★★☆

EASEOFUSE ★★★★★VALUE FOR MONEY ★★★★☆

Kaspersky caught all the malware thrown at it by AV-Test, but didn't fare quite so well with AV-Comparatives, where it blocked 99.6% of threats. That's still impressive but it's the worst score of the four products reviewed here. Where Kaspersky excelled was in avoiding false positives, achieving a clean sheet in tests from both organisations.

The suite includes plenty of extras, such as the Safe Money browser, which you can use any time, not just when you're banking and buying; and the Network Monitor - a firewall that lets you control everything that accesses the internet. Trusted Applications mode only allows you to run programs vetted and approved by Kaspersky, while the suite's cleaning and maintenance tools get into your PC's nooks and crannies to clean non-standard settings and out-of-date applications.

VERDICT ☆☆☆☆☆

Despite its many tools and features, Kaspersky's performance rating of 96.8% makes it the least draining of PC resources of the suites we tested. Shop around, though, because it's available from retailers for far less than Kaspersky charges.

McAfee Total Protection 1 £13.27 (1 year, 10 devices)

Buy from Amazon: bit.ly/mcafee497

FEATURES ★★★☆☆ PERFORMANCE ★★★☆☆

EASEOFUSE ★★★★☆VALUE FOR MONEY ★★★★★

Having parted ways with its former owner, Intel, McAfee has fixed its damaged reputation and now offers vastly improved protection at a very competitive price.

Ironically, the version named Total Protection doesn't have as many features as its rivals - you get parental control but no backup or VPN options. However, the real meat of this product is in its virus scanner, Web Advisor browser extension (for Chrome and Firefox) and automatic software updater. These tools helped McAfee stop 99.4% of the malware in the tests but while Kaspersky fared worse in the AV-Comparatives test, Total Protection came last place in AV-Test's. It also recorded six false positives with AV-Comparatives, but scored a clean sheet with AV-Test. On the other hand, it did well in the performance tests, with only Kaspersky having a lesser impact on the test PC's operating system.

VERDICT ★★★★★

McAfee Total Protection isn't the most hawk-eyed security suite around and it's comparatively light on features. However, it's much better than it used to be, is very affordable and lightweight, and you can install it on twice as many devices.

OURVERDICT

We gave our Gold Award to Bitdefender Internet Security 2020 because it performed well, and is brimming with useful features and protection options. All this comes at a very affordable price, though it's still worth shopping around when it comes to renewal time.

If you don't mind paying a little more, you might consider plumping for Norton 360 Deluxe instead. Its protection was excellent, earning it our Silver Award, and it comes with handy extras in the form of online backup and a VPN.

Our Bronze Award winner is Kaspersky, which offered the lightest tool with the least impact on the day-to-day running of the PC it's installed on. Its protection isn't quite up to Bitdefender and Norton standards in the most recent tests, but it was better at avoiding false positives. -
